column5: Is the ice ready?
Damn it stopped already... I was hoping to see a parade of army trucks on the dvp
LOL! I drove through a squall on the way home on the 404. Was hoping for a couple inches when I got home to take the sled out
Ya it snowed here in Brantford today...Wasnt impressed....

don't they consider it a natural disaster after 20cms?  We had a solid blast of snow near Marten River today. Its nice to witness the first blanket of snow in the region.  Some of the highways were even shutdown near Wawa and north of Thessalon. Yikes.

Last week Friday I headed west to my son's house in Dayton, Ohio.....along the way in PA near Lake Erie we ran into about 3-4" of snow....several car crashes....at one time I put old Tundra into 4X4 because the roads were SLICK...meanwhile, we did stop in PA for a pee break....and young Tundra got her first meeting and eating with snow....
in T.O. more like 20mm
Sing Dino!
KEEP IT IN THE SOUTH ! THATS WHERE ITS NEEDED THE MOST .............LOL
I am afraid we're going to get nail up here tonight .
talk to me skipper, what's happening tonight?
never mind, couldn't take the suspense so I looked it up...here we go (maybe)

I can also report that it was snowing today in Red Lake, Balmertown, Ear Falls, Vermillion Bay, Dryden, Ignace, Upsala, and Shabaqua. This is starting to sound like a Hank "Snow" song. Get it? Hank Snow??
Don't be scared skip!
No doubt. When I lived there, people were smashing their cars up at the first sight of snowflake. It was rather ridiculous.
They still do, lol!  When it snows, I don't even bother driving into work.  I work from home on my couch.
Aha ! as you can see , we all have our answer now . The white stuff. Me scared NAW , only when the equipment is not ready go .....lol
By 20cm they are dispatching Search and Rescue choppers!
had a good amount of snow covering the ground in Keswick this morning when I woke up.
double digit temps and rain this weekend. put your augers back in the basement!!
So has the army been put on alert just in case???
